title: BBC News - Home
description: The latet stories from the Home section of the BBC News web site.

Items.title: Brexit causes dramatic drop in UK economy, data suggests
Items.description: UK economic activity in July fell at its fastest rate since the aftermath of the financial crisis in 2009, data compiled from business questionnaires shows

Items.title: Fatima Manji complains over Kelvin MacKenzie hijab remarks
Items.description: Channel 4 News reporter Fatima Manji complains to the press watchdog over comments made by Sun columnist Kelvin MacKenzie about her wearing a hijab while reporting the Nice attack

Items.title: Great Ouse river search: Woman's body found
Items.description: A body is found by police searching for a mother-of-three who went missing while playing with her children in a river

Items.title: Sam Allardyce named England manager by the Football Association
Items.description: Sam Allardyce is appointed England manager, signing an initial two-year contract after leaving Sunderland

Items.title: Hate crime 'still far too high' post-Brexit - police
Items.description: More than 6,000 hate crimes have been reported to police in England, Wales and Northern Ireland in the wake of the EU referendum, figures show

Items.title: Labour leadership: Female MPs urge Corbyn to tackle abuse
Items.description: More than 40 female Labour MPs have written to party leader Jeremy Corbyn urging him to do more to tackle abuse

Items.title: Neighbours jailed for shining laser pen at police helicopter
Items.description: Two neighbours who shone a laser pen into the cockpit of a police helicopter during a search for a missing person are jailed

Items.title: Prince George's third birthday marked with release of photos
Items.description: Four photographs of Prince George at the family home in Norfolk are released by the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge to mark his third birthday

Items.title: Standing room only at lonely WW2 soldier funeral
Items.description: Standing room only at funeral of World War Two soldier after appeals are made on social media

Items.title: Seaside trip mum and friend locked up naked boy for hours
Items.description: A mother and her friend who locked her young son naked in a cupboard for hours while they went on a day trip to the seaside, are jailed

Items.title: Sports Direct staff 'not treated as humans', says MPs' report
Items.description: Retailer Sports Direct is accused in a report by MPs of failing to treat its workers like human beings

Items.title: Former teachers guilty of abusing boys at Fife residential school
Items.description: Two former teachers are convicted of sexually and physically abusing boys at a residential school in Fife in the late 1970s and early 1980s

Items.title: Charity worker to broadcast from buried coffin
Items.description: A recovered drug addict and charity worker has taken on the challenge to bury himself for several days and broadcast it live online

Items.title: Corbyn 'regrets Eagle's language'
Items.description: Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn says he regrets language used by Angela Eagle - who had challenged him for the leadership - when she claimed he had allowed a permissive environment in which she was subject to threat

Items.title: Inside 'bankrupt' businessman Alan Yeomans' secret mansion
Items.description: A businessman who claimed he was bankrupt has been jailed after cannabis was found in a secret room in his illegally-built £1.2m mansion

Items.title: Bikers who reached 146mph and performed wheelies banned
Items.description: Six motorbike riders are banned from driving after travelling at speeds of over 100mph and performing wheelies

Items.title: Sharp increase in use of mobile phone banking apps
Items.description: There has been a dramatic increase in the number of people using mobile phone apps to do their banking

Items.title: The Queen's wedding dress goes on display
Items.description: The Queen's 1947 wedding dress will be a star attraction at a new Buckingham Palace exhibition

Items.title: Usain Bolt: 60 second hula hoop challenge
Items.description: BBC Breakfast put Olympic sprinting legend Usain Bolt on the spot with 60 seconds of quick-fire questions

Items.title: Steven Spielberg has just won at life. He's got a Gold Blue Peter badge
Items.description: Steven Spielberg wins the ultimate accolade...a Gold Blue Peter badge
